meanings.definition: Lack of tolerance or acceptance of differing opinions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: Her intolerances towards new ideas made it difficult for her to work in a team.
meanings.sent2: The community's intolerances towards diversity hindered progress.
meanings.sent3: His intolerances towards pineapple on pizza sparked a heated debate at the party.
meanings.sent4: The company's intolerances towards innovation stifled creativity in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's intolerances towards mistakes created a fear of failure among students.

meanings.definition: Inability to digest certain foods or substances.
meanings.sent1: His intolerances to dairy products led him to choose lactose-free alternatives.
meanings.sent2: Many people suffer from intolerances to gluten, causing them to avoid wheat products.
meanings.sent3: Her intolerances to spicy food made her friends joke that she was a 'spice wimp'.
meanings.sent4: The body's intolerances to artificial sweeteners can result in digestive discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The child's intolerances to nuts meant extra care had to be taken in meal preparation.
